data.text: Draghi: Governments should consider shifting towards more growth-friendly fiscal consolidation
Draghi: Monetary policy has done a lot but it cannot do the work of others
Draghi: Endless debt creation does not produce sustainable growth
Draghi: Monetary policy can not address local bubbles. Local bubbles require local instruments.
Draghi: Very timid signs of improvement also in labour markets
Draghi: Our monetary policy has been very accommodative
Draghi: In core inflation most of downward trend comes from programme countries
Draghi: One has to look at sources of low inflation. Part of these sources are  global.
Draghi: OMT falls squarely into our mandate, it is fully legal.
Draghi: Banking union is an open design and not meant to be exclusive to euro area countries
Draghi: Geopolitical impact of what is happening in Ukraine could go way beyond statistics
Draghi: OMT is fully ready to be activated if needed, when conditions are fulfilled. Nothing has changed.
Draghi: SSM decides whether bank is viable. It is up to SRM to decide whether it should be put in resolution.
Introductory statement Mario Draghi at hearing of Economic and Monetary Affairs committee of the European Parliament  http://t.co/JumHxzQGkB
Draghi: Adjustment programmes of countries were by and large what was needed and is still needed.
Draghi: There is no point in pushing integration as far as we can. This is neither economically necessary nor politically realistic.
Draghi: A strong second pillar of banking union, a Single Resolution Mechanism, needs to be agreed before the end of this legislature.
Draghi: People in the euro area are still suffering from the inevitable adjustment process following years of accumulated imbalances
Draghi: But the glass is half-full, it is too early to claim “mission accomplished”
Draghi: In less than five years, the euro area has taken a remarkable leap forward that has kept us together.
Draghi: At the national level, imbalances are receding and foundations are being laid for improved competitiveness and stronger growth.
Draghi: Four years after the first Member States requested financial assistance, today we can safely say that the worst has been averted
Draghi: In exceptional circumstances, our measures were exceptional. But our commitment to our primary objective has not changed.
Draghi: All our measures, standard and non-standard, have been taken to serve our primary objective of maintaining price stability
Statement by the EC, ECB, and IMF on the Eleventh Review Mission to Portugal. http://t.co/qYbeIzjsWQ

Cœuré: IMF involvement in troika has been very useful because of experience which euro area did not have #TroikaInquiry
Cœuré: Deauville agreement has contributed to the escalation of the crisis #TroikaInquiry
Cœuré: ECB has always advocated a fair burden sharing in the adjustment process #TroikaInquiry
Cœuré: International doctrine has moved from bail-out to bail-in. ECB supports this. But in 2010 there was no framework.
Cœuré: community law will prevail in the future
Cœuré: troika will not be there forever
Cœuré: the best insurance against having to undergo swift and painful adjustments is to conduct sound fiscal and structural policies
Cœuré: with hindsight and taking into account the difficult situation at the time, the troika has provided sound advice
Cœuré: the troika was the best available instrument in the given circumstances
Cœuré: the programmes were the necessary answer to some Member States finding themselves at the verge of default
Cœuré: we should not blame the fire brigade for the fire
